intro: Uragoga palicourea, commonly known as the Brazilian star apple, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces a fruit that is typically green when unripe and turns yellow or red when mature. Its botanical features include a woody stem and opposite leaf arrangement. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and edible fruit.
